availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Smith Phillips (Union County, Kentucky, merchant, 2nd lieut (CSA), and prov gov't com rep)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Elizabeth "Bettie" Taylor Phillips, in Union County on September 26, 1849. Merchant in Union County in 1860. Employed John R. Taylor as a clerk in Union County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Union Count in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as second lieutenant and assistant quartermaster from September 14, 1861 to May 8, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Uniontown, p. 536.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Uniontown, p. 418A.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Union County Marriages, Film #000562199, p. 345.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0102.
